      • testConstructorWithDefaultLearningPeriodAndEstimationSamples

        public void testConstructorWithDefaultLearningPeriodAndEstimationSamples()
        This test attempts to find the anomaly-probability after create an AnomalyLikelihood instance with default values for the learning period and estimation samples. This used to generate an exception stating that you must have at least one anomaly score.

      • testNormalProbability

        public void testNormalProbability()

      • testEstimateNormal

        public void testEstimateNormal()
        This passes in a known set of data and ensures the estimateNormal function returns the expected results.

      • testSampleDistribution

        public void testSampleDistribution()
        Test that sampleDistribution from a generated distribution returns roughly the same parameters.

      • testEstimateAnomalyLikelihoods

        public void testEstimateAnomalyLikelihoods()
        This calls estimateAnomalyLikelihoods to estimate the distribution on fake data and validates the results

      • testEstimateAnomalyLikelihoodsMalformedRecords

        public void testEstimateAnomalyLikelihoodsMalformedRecords()
        NOTE: SKIPPED This calls AnomalyLikelihood.estimateAnomalyLikelihoods(List, int, int) to estimate the distribution on fake data and validates the results

      • testAnomalyProbabilityArrayCopying

        public void testAnomalyProbabilityArrayCopying()
        This tests the anomalyProbability method with a number of calls that will trigger copying of the sample array.

      • testSkipRecords

        public void testSkipRecords()
        This calls estimateAnomalyLikelihoods with various values of skipRecords

      • testUpdateAnomalyLikelihoods

        public void testUpdateAnomalyLikelihoods()
        A slight more complex test. This calls estimateAnomalyLikelihoods to estimate the distribution on fake data, followed by several calls to updateAnomalyLikelihoods.

      • testFlatAnomalyScores

        public void testFlatAnomalyScores()
        This calls estimateAnomalyLikelihoods with flat distributions and ensures things don't crash.

      • testFlatMetricScores

        public void testFlatMetricScores()
        This calls estimateAnomalyLikelihoods with flat metric values. In this case we should use the null distribution, which gets reasonably high likelihood for everything.

      • testVeryFewScores

        public void testVeryFewScores()
        This calls estimateAnomalyLikelihoods and updateAnomalyLikelihoods with one or no scores.

      • testFilterLikelihoodsInputType

        public void testFilterLikelihoodsInputType()
        NOTE: Not a valid test in java. Remnant of Python ability to substitute types, so we just do a simple test

      • testFilterLikelihoods

        public void testFilterLikelihoods()
         Tests _filterLikelihoods function for several cases:
 i.   Likelihood goes straight to redzone, skipping over yellowzone, repeats
 ii.  Case (i) with different values, and numpy array instead of float list
 iii. A scenario where changing the redzone from four to five 9s should
      filter differently
